newsitem.title: USA: Kenwin Shops closes stores to cut losses.
newsitem.headline: Kenwin Shops closes stores to cut losses.

text.p: Kenwin Shops Inc said Friday it closed 27 unprofitable stores to reduce operating losses. The company said store closing costs were "nominal."
The company said it believes the closings, which began in February, and its reductions in its corporate staff will return it to profitability.
The company also said it is planning further cuts in general overhead, and it may close additional stores.
Kenwin now operates 54 stores in 7 states. The company said the remaining stores are profitable before general overhead expenses.
Kenwin reported a loss of $294,424 on revenues of $1.9 million for the first quarter compared to a loss of $842,295 on revenues of $3.0 million for the same period a year ago.
